venue.address_1: On I-93/Route 3, Franconia Notch Parkway (Northbound Side)
venue.name: The Basin

item.description:
WINTER WHITE MOUNTAIN SERIES:

Bridle Path to Mt. Lafayette up;

Liberty Spring Trail, Bushwhack to The Basin Down


HIKE IT! (but review ALL the details below ...)

EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). Please feel free to email me with your thoughts about this trip.

 

DIFFICULTY

Total Mileage, Total Climb, Estimated Hike Time:

About 13.2 miles, about 4,640' ASL vertical climbing.

NOTE: This includes a bushwhack of about .6 miles I've never done ... it may or may not be broken out ... so this piece is a bit of an experiment!  As always for winter hikes, this event is HIGHLY WEATHER DEPENDENT ... this WILL get rescheduled in the event of bad weather.  STAY CLOSE TO THE EVENT POST FOR UPDATES.

 

SPECIAL GEAR REQUIREMENTS: Snow shoes, poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes and / or crampons, are ESSENTIAL as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Dress in non-wicking layers and bring extra gloves, socks and tops. Prepare for freezing conditions; bring a balaclava / face covering and charcoal heaters for hands and feet.

Be sure to have a method for backpack attachment for your friction gear.  Be sure to try out your gear before you start out for your first winter trip!  We MAY be hiking out in the dark so ... bring extra batteries!!! Test your lights!!!


CLICK HERE:

UP-TO-DATE SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION

CLICK HERE: GOOGLE MAP LINK FROM

  • (A)  Meetup / car spot location at The Basin, to
  • (B)  Hike start at the Lafayette Campground / hiker parking area

PLEASE TEST THIS LINK BEFORE YOU GO ... DIRECT QUESTIONS VIA EMAIL BEFORE THE EVENT ... IT'S YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO KNOW WHERE WE ARE MEETING.

This is a DOG-FRIENDLY event (and as always, Mike is coming!!!) ... if you don't like dogs, sorry ... this event isn't for you!

 

CLICK / VIEW / TAKE WITH YOU:

Purchase a full version of this map HERE.


EVENT SUMMARY / UPDATES

(02/14/2013  9:45 p.m.):

  • This 13.2-mile hike follows the busy Bridle Path / Greenleaf Trail up to Mt. Lafayette and the Franconia Ridge, a spectacularly beautiful alpine ridge known for its harsh weather.  Temps are expected to be in the teens but the lapse rate will mean the ridgeline will be in the single digits.
  • Winds on this range will be very brisk.  Anticipate moving very quickly along the unprotected, alpine section.  Make sure you have protection for your face.
  • This is a cross-posted event with Hudson Valley Hikers.

 

WEB LINKS FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

I'LL BE COMPLETING THIS SECTION AFTER RECEIVING ATTENDEE INTEREST.

THE FINE PRINT -- PLEASE NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HUDSON VALLEY HIKER EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK HERE.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. See you there! Julie. 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.
